answer.explanation:
W-am: Excuse me sir, Q1 I think you might be sitting in my seat. My ticket says I’m supposed to be in seat A by the window.
M-Cn: Q2 I’m sure I’m in 14A. Let’s look at your boarding pass. Hmm, I see the problem, Q2 You’re seated right behind me.
W-Am: Oh, thanks, but...would you mind changing places with me? My colleague's going to be sitting in 14B, and we have some business to discuss on the trip.
M-Cn: Sure, that's fine. I just want a window seat. Q3 We probably should tell the flight attendant about the switch, though.

question.text: What is the purpose of the conversation?
Look at the graphic. Which seat was the woman originally assigned to?
What does the man recommend doing?
choices: (D) Notifying flight staff of a change

answer.text: (D) Notifying flight staff of a change

Transcript:
M: Hello, this is Tim Mason speaking. I live on Maria Street. Q1 All the electricity at my house has gone out.
W: I’m very sorry, sir. It looks like a tree fell on a power line and knocked out all the power on your street.
M: Yeah, that’s what I expected. Do you know how long it will take to restore the electricity?
W: Q2 Because of all the storm damage, our repair teams are behind schedule. Q3 In the meantime, I suggest you stay at a family member or friend’s house.

question.text: What problem does the man report?
choices: (B) A delivery has not arrived yet.

question.text: Where most likely does the woman work?
What does the woman suggest the man do?
choices: (B) Report the incident to the police

answer.explanation:
W-Br: Hi, Arlo. How’s the townhouse renovation project going?
M-Cn: Good! Q1 The house is old, but it doesn’t have any structural problems—we've made a lot of progress.
W-Br: Great! I’d really like to put this property on the market in the beginning of April —it's the best time to sell a house. Will all the work be completed by then?
M-Cn: Let me check my calendar. So...we've just completed the floor installation, and Q2 we’re going to start painting next week. So yes, we should be done by the end of March.
W-Br: OK! Q3 Could you send me some information about your total expenses? It’ll help me come up with a price for the house.

question.text: What most likely is the man's profession?
Look at the graphic. What stage of the renovation will begin next week?
What does the woman ask the man to send?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hello, I need to send a package to my brother who lives overseas in Germany. What delivery method would be best?
M: Well, it really depends on what you’re sending. Q1 Because we are a public post office, we don’t offer that many options.
W: Q2 Actually, it was my brother’s birthday last week, but I forgot. So I’m in a hurry to send this package. Also, what I’m sending is somewhat fragile.
M: Q3 In that case, I suggest you use a private delivery service. Private companies provide a larger variety of services that we don’t offer.

question.text: Where does the man work?
Why is the woman in a hurry?
What does the man recommend?

answer.explanation:
M-Au: Q1 Judy, did you know we’re considering buying Yantz Foods? I just read the report - have you seen it?
W-Am: No, not yet. What does it say?
M Au: Well, we still wouldn’t be the biggest company in the industry, but we’d be much more competitive. The first page shows the industry market shares.
W-Am: So, Q2 it looks like we’re already the second biggest, and acquiring Yantz Foods will definitely keep our market share larger than Bowlton’s.
M-Au: That’s right, I think acquiring the company would be the right move.
W-Am: Well now that I’m reading the report Q3 I’m not sure .I see that Yantzs profits went down last quarter - maybe it isn't such a good idea.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
Look at the graphic. Where do the speakers work?
Why does the woman say she is not convinced?
choices: (A) The man is not familiar with a business strategy.
(C) She does not want to hire new employees.

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hi, Mr. Winston. This is Sharon Smith. Q1 I was the person interested in buying the used Speedster sports car that you showed me last week. I checked my financial situation and I’ve decided to go ahead with the purchase.
M: Hi, Ms. Smith. Well, unfortunately, we already sold that car to somebody yesterday. However, I have a similar model that you could look at. The car is used, but it is in great shape and just had new tires put on it.
W: Oh, that’s too bad that you already sold the model. Q2 That car had a really good safety rating, which is what I consider most important when buying a car.
M: I see. Well, this similar model also has a five-star safety rating. Q3 Why don’t you come here this week? You can take a look at it and take it for a test drive.

question.text: What type of business does the man work for?
What does the woman say is her top priority when she makes a purchase?
What does the man suggest doing?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Hello, Judy. Q1 Have you got a moment to discuss last week’s sales figures?
W: Q2 I’m actually on my way to a meeting, but you can ask me something briefly.
M: Q1 The sales figures for your branch are much lower than they have ever been. The board of directors is pretty upset about it. Is everything OK at the office?
W: Well, not really. There are some problems with my staff at the moment and they aren’t working like they used to. There is a conflict between some of the staff. I know it’s affecting sales figures and it is a serious problem.
M: Really? Q3 Do you think we need to fire someone?
W: I think that’s the only solution. I’m going to see how they go in the next week and I will make a decision.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
What does the woman mean when she says “I’m actually on my way to a meeting”?
choices: (A) She doesn’t have a lot of time to talk.
(B) She can stay and chat for a long time,
(C) She is asking the man out to lunch.
(D) She will send him an e-mail later on.

answer.text: (A) She doesn’t have a lot of time to talk.

question.text: What possible solution does the man suggest?
choices: (B) That the woman should be fired
(D) The woman might have to fire someone.

answer.text: (D) The woman might have to fire someone.

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hello, Mr. Morgan. This is Debra. Q1 We have a bit of a problem. The person that was supposed to give the keynote speech next week is sick. So we need to find a replacement. Would you be able to do it?
M: I’ll be out of town for the next four days on business and when I get back I’ll be quite busy.
W: I see. Q2 The board of directors would love to have you do the speech. They really liked it last time you delivered it.
M: Q3 Thanks, but I’ll have to pass on it. I just have too much on my plate at the moment. If I had some more time to prepare, I would have considered it.
W: OK, I understand. I’ll let the board know. I hope you have a safe trip.
M: Thanks for your understanding, Debra.

question.text: What is the problem?
choices: (A) The person who was supposed to give the speech is sick.
(B) The person who was giving the speech said they don’t want to.
(C) There is no keynote speech anymore.

answer.text: (A) The person who was supposed to give the speech is sick.

question.text: What does the woman ask the man?
choices: (A) She asks him to find someone to do the speech.
(B) She says she will deliver the speech.
(C) She asks him to deliver the keynote speech.
(D) She says the board is not happy.

answer.text: (C) She asks him to deliver the keynote speech.

question.text: What does the man imply when he says “Thanks, but I’ll have to pass on it”?
choices: (B) He doesn’t want to deliver the speech,
(c) He will talk to the board of directors.

answer.text: (B) He doesn’t want to deliver the speech,

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Tristar Logistics, how can I help you?
M: Hello. Q1 I have a delivery coming today but I won’t be at the office all day. Can you reschedule to deliver for another day?
W: No problem. If you prefer, we can leave it with someone at your office?
M: Q2 That won’t work for me. The delivery contains some expensive pieces of art so I want to personally receive it.
W: That’s fine. When would you like it delivered?
M: Before midday would be perfect.
W: Q3 OK, if you could give me your cell phone number, I can have the delivery man call you when he is in your neighborhood.

question.text: Why is the man calling Tristar Logistics?
What does he imply when he says “That won’t work for me”?
choices: (B) He will pay with a money order.
(C) He doesn’t want them to leave it with someone at the office.
(D) He wants it left at the office.

answer.text: (C) He doesn’t want them to leave it with someone at the office.

question.text: What does the woman say she wants?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M1: Hi Ruth, hi Greg. Q1 Unfortunately, there is going to be a delay on the delivery of your computer equipment. We won’t be able to deliver it until tomorrow.
W: We needed that equipment today. Q2 We are going to miss some important deadlines without that equipment.
M2: If we miss that deadline, we might lose some very important clients. Is there any possible way you can get it to US today?
M1: I’m sorry it’s not possible. We haven’t received the equipment at our distribution center yet.
W: OK. I know another supplier who can guarantee same-day delivery. Q3 I’m going to call them and ask if they can supply US with the equipment.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
choices: (B) The signing of a rental contract

question.text: What problem do the speakers have?
choices: (B) They will miss some important deadlines.
(C) They need to train their new staff.

answer.text: (B) They will miss some important deadlines.

question.text: What does the woman suggest they do?
